Header: IMF extends its loan assistance programme for another year
Content: The International Monetary Fund has decided to extend by another year the loan assistance programme given to Sri Lanka. Under this agreement a sum of 1.5 Billion US Dollars is slated to be given to Sri Lanka. The loan assistance programme extended to Sri Lanka by the International Monetary Fund was operative for three years. Accordingly it would be extended for four years. Therefore the IMF has reached an agreement also to release the sixth loan tranche to Sri Lanka.
